meanings.definition: To be a perfect example of something.
meanings.sent1: Her kindness epitomises what it means to be a good friend.
meanings.sent2: The majestic lion epitomises strength and courage in the animal kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy penguin tried to epitomise grace by attempting ballet.
meanings.sent4: The old oak tree epitomises resilience, standing tall through every storm.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant sunset over the ocean epitomises beauty and tranquility.

meanings.definition: To embody the essential characteristics of something.
meanings.sent1: His actions epitomise honesty and integrity in our community.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ruins epitomise the rich history of this land.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tried to epitomise wisdom by wearing glasses.
meanings.sent4: The melody of the song epitomises the emotions of a broken heart.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked bread epitomises comfort and home.
